description: Number of ordered tricoverings of an unlabeled n-set.
comments: A covering of a set is a tricovering if every element of the set is covered by exactly three blocks of the covering.
formula: E.g.f. for ordered k-block tricoverings of an unlabeled n-set is exp(-x+x^2/2+x^3/3*y/(1-y))*Sum_{k=0..inf}1/(1-y)^binomial(k, 3)*exp(-x^2/2*1/(1-y)^n)*x^k/k!.
example: There are 184 ordered tricoverings of an unlabeled 3-set: 4 4-block, 60 5-block and 120 6-block tricoverings (cf. A060492).
author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Mar 20 2001
